intro: Brachystelma schinzii, commonly known as the Schinz's ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming during the winter months. Its fleshy, thick leaves help it store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. Brachystelma schinzii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
